result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanya S Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid within the first six months of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption of alcohol & no entering into any bars or taverns.
Must submit a DNA sample if one has not already been submitted.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

timeConds.notes: Community service to be completed within the first year after release from custody.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanya S Cooper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tanya S Cooper in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Tanya S Cooper in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:48 AM. State - resolved - enter G to only count as alleged - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 365 days in FC jail, $2000.00 fine plus costs and surcharges and standard probation conditions. Joy and Cooper agree. Cooper peads G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cooper withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), $2000.00 fine plus costs and surcharges (DNA) totalling $5198.00 - to be paid within the first 6 months of probation, AODA and follow thru, attend at least one AA meeting per week while on probation, 300 hours of community service - to be completed within the first year after release from custody, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample if one has not already been submitted, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Tanya S Cooper in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:48 p.m. Joy - Matter has not been resolved. Bond continues.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tanya S Cooper in court with attorney Jeffery Joy (appearing telephonically).  Defendant Tanya S Cooper in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:15 PM. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendnat has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed Information that mirrors complaint. Joy will waive reading of Information, will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
and certificate of appearance - Deputy AW
and certificate of appearance - Deputy AC

Defendant Tanya S Cooper not in court, appears via video defendant in custody and without counsel.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:34 am. Defendant has complaint. Court advises of charges, penalties and rights and right to attorney. Cooper understands - wants attorney has attorney Joy - believes that he will be here today. Will recall when Joy will be here. Recalled at 1:52 PM, now appears with Jeff Joy and defendant appears via video from FOSO. Joy and Cooper have complaint, waives reading, requests PH, waives time limits, set for PH on 2/9/15 at 1:00 PM. Joy requests signature bond. State - no objections. Court - $2500 signature bond with same conditions, no consumption of alcohol.
